1.title: What If I Don't Move to the Back of the Bus?
1.subtitle: Rosa Parks brought together a unique blend of life experiences, a commitment to racial justice, and a flawless reputation to transform a single act of defiance into a defining moment for the modern American civil rights movement.

2.title: Darlyng & Co.

There’s a multi-purpose clip designed for strollers or diaper bags so it can travel with you. Exploring role play fun at home and on the go. Yummy Buddy has crinkly ears, both chewable "glow" silicone hands, teething bib, multiple colors, and chimes when shaken, too! The perfect sensory chew toy.

3.title: 360 Magazine
3.subtitle:
360 is an edgy fashion, lifestyle and culture magazine. We will introduce cutting-edge brands, entities and trends to tastemakers within their respective communities. Our founding members have over 30 years of collective experience both as notable talent and uber professionals within the realm of fashion, music, art, design and entertainment. We are more than just a magazine comprised of journalists, representing a movement of social awareness and change.

We are a LGBTQIA friendly publication. The magazine is contemporary in look and appeal. Quality art content is the constant goal. The magazine will be entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking. It will appeal to a broad entertainment readership. No magazine like it is available today, constantly celebrating racial and sexual ambiguous talent and artists.

10.title: Shades of My Melanin LLC

11.title: Seeing White Podcast Series
11.subtitle: Just what is going on with white people? Police shootings of unarmed African Americans. Acts of domestic terrorism by white supremacists. The renewed embrace of raw, undisguised white-identity politics. Unending racial inequity in schools, housing, criminal justice, and hiring. Some of this feels new, but in truth it’s an old story.

11.title: Fight for Breonna
11.subtitle: Breonna survived the frontlines of a pandemic that disproportionately kills Black people, only to have her life stolen by police. Take Action.

12.title: Derek Chauvin sentencing
12.subtitle: A Hennepin County jury found Derek Chauvin guilty on all three counts against him on Tuesday, April 20, 2021, setting the stage for the sentencing of the former Minneapolis officer. Here's what we know about when sentencing will happen and what to expect.

12.title: Register to Vote
12.subtitle: Register to vote to make your voice heard and make sure the people we elect to positions of power have the best interests of every American in mind.

13.title: The New Jim Crow
13.subtitle: The New Jim Crow is a stunning account of the rebirth of a caste-like system in the United States, one that has resulted in millions of African Americans locked behind bars and then relegated to a permanent second-class status—denied the very rights supposedly won in the Civil Rights Movement.

13.title: Hiram Rhodes Revels - Biography
13.subtitle: A freeman his entire life, Hiram Rhodes Revels was the first African American to serve in the U.S. Congress. With his moderate political orientation and oratorical skills honed from years as a preacher, Revels filled a vacant seat in the United States Senate in 1870.

14.title: Accountability in a Time of Justice
14.subtitle: Accountability is a well-worn word in social justice circles. We have worked hard to figure out what accountability means to us as we attempt to walk our social justice talk.

14.title: Plum Good

products.name: Sweet & Hot Chocolate Sauce

15.title: Children's Books Starring Kids of Color
15.subtitle: Jambo Books is a children's book subscription company.  We send our members 2 or 3 books each month that feature a child of color as the star of a fiction story.
15.moreInfo:
Jambo Books serves children from birth to age 13. Our oldest members, ages 10-13, receive a middle grade novel and a nonfiction companion book that expands on a topic discussed in the novel. We focus on stories about children of color to delight your young readers and reaffirm your values of creating an inclusive and welcoming community.

Jambo means “Hello” in Swahili. Hello is an invitation to start a connection, to learn something new, to expand our notion of what it is to be human. Similarly, we invite our readers to build their own empathy muscles by reading about people who aren't exactly like themselves. Together, we affirm the humanity of every person.

21.title: Color of Change
21.subtitle: Color Of Change was founded in moments just like this one. As Black communities reeled in grief as all levels of government failed to protect Black people in the wake of Hurricane Katrina, we recognized that not enough of the people and institutions with power over our lives had any fear of disappointing Black people. For the last 15 years, we've focused on building that power.

21.title: The symbols of systemic racism — and how to take away their power
21.subtitle: Multidisciplinary artist and TED Fellow Paul Rucker is unstitching the legacy of systemic racism in the United States. A collector of artifacts connected to the history of slavery — from branding irons and shackles to postcards depicting lynchings — Rucker couldn't find an undamaged Ku Klux Klan robe for his collection, so he began making his own.

22.title: United Negro College Fund
22.subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

22.title: Big Mama's Sauce
22.subtitle: We believe that to be the best we must use only the best ingredients. This homemade recipe has been the highlight of our family gatherings since at least 2002…honestly Big Mama can’t even remember, that’s how long she been making it! Big Mama never liked store bought sauce and she wanted to serve only the best to her loved ones. So here we are…on the store shelf ironically! Lol…We hope you taste only love and enjoy just as our family has for all of these years!

In it, he explores what an antiracist society might look like, how we can play an active role in building it, and what being an antiracist in your own context might mean.

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Gala Edition
products.description: Princess Omalie comes from a royal lineage of beautiful elegant women and embodies the kindness, confidence and excitement of young girls today. In this Gala Edition, she is exquisitely dressed and coiffed.

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Coronation Edition

As a treat, she holds a special key as your invitation to unlock the magic of her kingdom.

products.name: Princess Omalie, The Coronation And The Polka Dot Lamb
products.description: Princess Omalie of the African kingdom of IgboOrai could be the happiest girl on the planet — except that her family has been under a curse. Unless the curse of the Goliath beetle necklace is lifted, Omalie’s father might die in a horrible freak accident. He might never be crowned king. Omalie worries about her family, and about her own safety; how will she ever lead a peaceful happy life, have friends, and go to school?

28.title: Robert Tanner Freeman - Bytes of History
28.subtitle: Robert Tanner Freeman was born in Washington DC in 1846. He was the son of slaves who had bought their freedom in the 19th century. Historical records are unclear but they probably adopted the surname Freeman in response to their transition.

30.title: 3 ways to speak English
30.subtitle: Jamila Lyiscott is a "tri-tongued orator" in her powerful spoken-word essay "Broken English," she celebrates — and challenges — the three distinct flavors of English she speaks with her friends, in the classroom and with her parents. As she explores the complicated history and present-day identity that each language represents, she unpacks what it means to be "articulate."

31.title: Why Protests and Riots Work
31.subtitle: Riots are destructive, dangerous, and scary — but can lead to serious social reforms. To prevent more violent uprisings and protests, we need to take their causes seriously.
